title: Sols 4259-4260: Kings Canyon Go Again!
summary: Earth planning date: Monday, July 29, 2024 Our weekend drill preload test on the target “Kings Canyon” (shown in the accompanying MAHLI image) didn’t give us the full range of data we need to move forward with the full drilling process. This coming Wednesday, we hope to rerun our preload test on Kings Canyon or somewhere […]

title: United Launch Alliance and SpaceX get $1.8 billion boost in Space Force contracts
summary: The increase is due to a surge in demand for launches under the National Security Space Launch Phase 2 program

title: GLOBE Alumna and Youth for Habitat Program Lead Named Scientist of the Month in Alaska
summary: As a 16-year old high school graduate, Maggie House decided to leave the military base in Germany where she lived with her family and go to college close to nature in Fairbanks, Alaska. She had lived in many countries and US states and knew she was ready. At the University of Alaska Fairbanks Troth Yeddha’ […]

title: Chinese scientists outline major cislunar space infrastructure project
summary: PRESTON, United Kingdom — Chinese scientists are proposing cislunar space infrastructure to support lunar exploration, enhance the nation’s space industry and promote international collaboration. The proposed infrastructure includes a comprehensive […]

title: NASA’s DART Mission Sheds New Light on Target Binary Asteroid System
summary: In studying data collected from NASA’s DART (Double Asteroid Redirection Test) mission, which in 2022 sent a spacecraft to intentionally collide with the asteroid moonlet Dimorphos, the mission’s science team has discovered new information on the origins of the target binary asteroid system and why the DART spacecraft was so effective in shifting Dimorphos’ orbit.  In five recently […]

title: Defying the heat
summary: Space agencies are advancing inflatable heat shields they see as not only key for future missions to Mars, but also for unlocking fully reusable rockets and larger cargo deliveries back […]

title: Land of the rising space startups
summary: Since April, a small Japanese spacecraft has been loitering in the vicinity of an abandoned upper stage from an H-2A rocket in low Earth orbit. The Active Debris Removal by […]

title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Takes Delivery of MIRA II and III Airframes
summary: Bremen-based startup POLARIS Spaceplanes has taken delivery of a pair of airframe structures for its MIRA II and MIRA III spaceplane demonstrators. MIRA II and III will be identical five-metre-long spaceplane demonstrators powered by four turbine jet engines and one of the company’s in-house-developed AS-1 linear aerospike rocket engines. The pair will replace the decommissioned […]

title: NASA proceeding with August launch of Crew-9
summary: NASA is pressing ahead with a mid-August launch of the next Crew Dragon mission while delaying the first operational flight of Starliner.

title: ULA’s Atlas 5 launches its final national security mission
summary: The rocket lifted off July 30 at 6:45 a.m. Eastern from Space Launch Complex-41 at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida.
